Row.Text: All technologies after the Classical Era cost 5% more science. [NEWLINE] Era Gate for technologies is increased to 30% (from 20% base game). This is a mechanic when you are researching technologies of an era ahead of the current game era whereby the cost of those technologies is increased. [NEWLINE] Tech Tree Changes [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Advanced Ballistics moved to a Modern Era technology, no dependencies changed. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Steam Power now requires Scientific Theory [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Steel eureka changed to "Own a Renaissance Wall" (from Build a Coal Mine and Ironclad) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Robotics now has Composites and Telecommunications as added tech prerequisites

[ICON_BULLET] +2 Combat Strength per turn of fortification up to a maximum of +4CS (from +3CS per turn up to a maximum of +6CS) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Land units no longer provide support bonus in water [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] The combat damage formula no longer includes RNG [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] A game option has been added to disable settler stealing. If enabled, settlers will simply be sent back to the nearest city (like great people)

All cities other than your capital start with +1 amenity bonus. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Happy cities receive +8% yields (from +10%) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Ecstatic cities receive +16% yields (from +20%) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Reduced the trade route gold bonus from efficiency points 2x to 1.5x [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Dark age threshold increased by 3 era score

[ICON_BULLET] +100% prod towards support units card moved from Communism tech to Ideology [ICON_BULLET] [b]Bastions[/b]: +0 city ranged strength (from +5) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Communications Office[/b]: +2 loyalty per governor promotion (from +1) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Discipline[/b]: Combat bonus against barbarian buffed to +10 (from +5) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Limes[/b]: never gets obsolete, +50% production toward walls (from 100%) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Medina Quarter[/b]: +1 Housing per District (from +2 Housing in cities with 3 specialty districts) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Military First[/b]: Unlocked at Mobilization (from Rapid Deployment) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Praetorium[/b]: +20% production on conquered cities with a governor and +4 loyalty for governors (from +2). [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Rationalism[/b], [b]Grand Opera[/b], [b]Simultaneum[/b] and [b]Free Market[/b]: Require 13 pop (from 15), and adjacency bonus of +3 (from +4) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Retinues[/b] and [b]Force Modernization[/b]: -50% of resource cost to both produce and upgrade units (from upgrade only) [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] All Strategic Resource policy cards now give a base +2 of the resource, in addition to the normal +1 by worked resource. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] All Melee and Ranged unit production policy cards now also include Recon units. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [u]3 new cards to boost Siege Unit production:[/u] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Siegecraft[/b]: Available at Military Tradition, +50% production towards ancient, classical and medieval era siege units. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Hard-shell Explosives[/b]: Available at Medieval Faires, +50% production towards siege units from renaissance era and before. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Trench Warfare[/b]: Available at Scorched Earth, +50% production towards all siege units [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Colonial Offices[/b]: +15% faster growth, +10% Production and 3 Loyalty per turn for cities 8 tiles away from your capital. [Obsolete at Colonialism] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Sovereign Trade[/b]: Open borders with all city states (obsolete at Ideology, as Ideology gives open borders with all city states), unlocked at Civil Service. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Gunboat Diplomacy[/b]: +4 points Influence points per turn toward earning Envoys and +1 Gold from each of your Envoys at city-states. (removed the open borders with city states but merged the card with Merchant Confederation). Merchant Confederation is now obsolete at Ideology [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Raj[/b]: +1 Prod, Food and +2 Science, Culture, Faith and Gold for Trade Route to city-states. (old bonus removed)

[ICON_BULLET] [b]Jade[/b]: +1 production, but can no longer spawn on plains (from +0, plains and grassland) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Mercury[/b]: +1 food / +1 science (from +0/+1) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Pearls[/b]: +1 production / +1 faith (from +0/+1) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Spices[/b]: +1 food / +1 gold (from +2/+0) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Tea[/b]: +1 food / +1 science (from +0/+1) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Cocoa[/b] and [b]Diamonds[/b]: Reduce base gold value to 2 (from 3) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Marble[/b] yield buffed: 1 culture -> 1 culture 2 gold [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Cotton[/b] yield buffed: 3 gold -> 4 gold

[ICON_BULLET][b]Battering Ram / Siege Tower[/b]: Obsolete at Military Science (from Civil Engineering) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Military Engineer[/b] [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] 3 movement (from 2) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] 3 charges (from 2) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Can build roads without using a charge [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Railroads moved to Scientific Theory (from Steam Power) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Tunnels moved to Military Science (from Chemistry) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Military Engineers can use a charge to complete 50% of a city's flood barrier production (from 20%) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Medic[/b]: Moved to Military Science (from Sanitation), grants +1 movement to melee, anti-cav, and ranged units (from +0) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Anti-Air Gun[/b]: Unlocked at Steel (from Advanced Ballistics) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Mobile SAM[/b]: +115 Anti-air combat strength (from +100) and -5 Anti-air combat strength vs all planes (total = +110 from +100). +2 movement (from 2 to 4)

[ICON_BULLET][b]Barracks, Stable, and Replacements[/b]: +2 production (from +2 production for units). Barracks give +2 iron per turn and Stables give +2 horses [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Armory[/b]: +2 Great General points (from +1), and gives +1 niter [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Military Academy[/b]: +2 Great General points (from +1), and +2 oil once revealed

[ICON_BULLET][b]Skirmisher[/b]: Combat Strength adjusted to 25/35 (from 20/30), 3 base vision (Warakaq 25/40) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Rangers[/b]: Combat Strength adjusted to 55/65 (from 45/60), 3 base vision (Highlander 65/70) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Spec Ops[/b]: Combat Strength adjusted to 65/75 (from 55/65), 3 base vision [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Skirmishers, Rangers, Spec Ops, and Warak'aq get +5 melee combat strength [NEWLINE] Promotion Changes: [NEWLINE][/t]Tier 2 (left, Sentry): see through woods/jungle and +1 sight [NEWLINE][/t]Tier 3 (left, spyglass): now called "Endurance", +2 PM [NEWLINE][/t]Tier 3 (right, ambush): +15 strength (from +20)
